revised_title: A Brief History and Evaluation of Conceptual Climate Models for Pre-Quaternary Time
tldr: The article discusses the history, strengths, and limitations of conceptual climate models for studying pre-Quaternary climate. It explains how these models, based on atmospheric circulation fundamentals, helped understand major climate changes driven by continental movements. Despite their simplicity, these models have proven to be robust and useful in predicting climate patterns for different geological periods.
